alert.note: Alert for Southeast Pocahontas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 3:03PM EST until January 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches, with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Southeast Pocahontas County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM EST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM Saturday to 10 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
